mdRecord.dcterms:title: Verdun
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Dépôt de la guerre (France)
France. Corps d'état-major.
United States. Army. Corps of Engineers. Regiment, 29th.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Printed at Base Printing Plant, 29th. Engineers, U.S. Army
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 53 x 83 cm. on sheet 59 x 85 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Reprint of the Verdun sector (Sheet 35) of a topographic map of France. Original publication details printed in lower margin: Levée par les Officiers du Corps d'Etat-Major, et publiée par le Dépôt de la Guerre en 1835. Revisée en 1911. Gravée le trait par Thierry, la lettre par Hacq, le figure du terrain par Blacher.
Sheet number"35" printed in upper right margin. Includes index to adjoining sheets and compilation diagram.
Relief shown with hachures and spot heights.
Verdun is near the southeast corner of the map, which extends west to Suippes then north to Ste. Vauborg in the west and Jametz in the east.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: World War, 1914-1918--France--Maps, Topographic.
Meuse (France)--Maps, Topographic.
Verdun (France)--Maps, Topographic.
